title: 110_s1411
content: The Act titled "Federal Government Greenhouse Gas Registry Act of 2007" amends the Clean Air Act to include a new section on Federal Greenhouse Gas Emissions with defined terms. The Act "Federal Government Greenhouse Gas Registry Act of 2007" defines key terms related to greenhouse gas emissions for Federal agencies, including agency emission baseline, direct emission, emission allowance, and emission baseline. The Act "Federal Government Greenhouse Gas Registry Act of 2007" defines key terms related to greenhouse gas emissions for Federal agencies, including emission baseline, energy indirect emission, greenhouse gas, and indirect emission. The Act "Federal Government Greenhouse Gas Registry Act of 2007" defines indirect emissions as greenhouse gas emissions resulting from Federal Government projects or activities, including employee travel and the use of energy-intensive materials like paper. The term 'Office' refers to the Federal Emissions Inventory Office established by section 702(a), while 'protocol' refers to the Greenhouse Gas Protocol Corporate Accounting and Reporting Standard developed by the World Resources Institute and World Business Council on Sustainable Development. "Federal Emissions Inventory Office established by section 702." The Federal Emissions Inventory Office is established within the Environmental Protection Agency to develop and maintain an emission inventory system for measuring direct and indirect emissions of the Federal Government. The Office must report to Congress and the Administrator if sufficient data is unavailable to establish an emission baseline. They should periodically review and revise the baseline as needed. The inventory or system developed must be used to account for various emissions and audited periodically. The inventory or system developed must be periodically audited to ensure data accuracy. Additional procedures are required to account for indirect emissions, and coordination with state and tribal registries is necessary. Annual reports to Congress and the Administrator are also mandated. The report must be submitted annually to Congress and the Administrator, detailing the aggregate quantity of emissions for the Federal Government and each Federal agency, including direct emissions, energy indirect emissions, and indirect emissions. Authorization of appropriations is granted to carry out the specified title.
